author: Staff Reporter
text:
Principal District Judge R. Poornima on Monday adjourned the hearing in Pasupathi Pandian murder case till March 1 and directed the accused to appear before the court on the date.

Nine accused, except Subhash Pannaiyar, appeared before Principal District and Sessions Court in connection with murder of Federation of Devendrakula Vellalars founder C. Pasupathi Pandian.

The accused who appeared before the court were Nirmala, Arulmani, Ramesh, Sannasi, Anandhan, Dhara Singh, Arul Anand and Sami alias Arumugasamy. The police also brought Rajesh, another accused, from Madurai Central Prison and produced him before the judge.

Of the 18 accused, two – Pura Pandi and Madasamy – died recently. The others did not appear before the court. A posse of police personnel had been deployed in the court complex. Later Rajesh was taken back to the Madurai prison.

Subhash Pannaiyar had surrendered before the court on December 18 last year.

An unidentified gang murdered Pasupathi Pandian at his residence at Nandhavanapatti on the outskirt of Dindigul on January 11, 2012.
title: Pasupathi Pandian murder case hearing adjourned till March 1
